sentences: Ta oli kogu hinge vappar mees.
See oli vapram võitleja oma aastapäeval.
context: The word 'vapper' is an Estonian adjective meaning brave, courageous, or intrepid. It describes someone who shows fearlessness and courage in the face of danger. The word has different forms in Estonian grammar: genitive singular 'vapra', partitive singular 'vaprat', plural nominative 'vaprad'. As seen in dictionary examples, it can be used to describe people (vapper sõjamees - brave soldier), actions (tegi vapra näo pähe - made a brave face on his head), and even animals. The word comes from Proto-Germanic roots related to being fair or suitable.
